afwCamelCaseFunctionLabel.brief: The functionLabel prefixed with 'afw' and converted to camel case
afwCamelCaseFunctionLabel.description: This is the functionLabel prefixed with 'afw' and converted to camel case.
afwCamelCaseFunctionLabel.label: Prefixed Camel Case

brief.description: This is a predicate for the function with the first letter capitalized and without a trailing period.
brief.label: Brief

camelCaseFunctionLabel.brief: The functionLabel converted to camel case.
camelCaseFunctionLabel.description: This is the functionLabel converted to camel case.
camelCaseFunctionLabel.label: Camel Case

dataType.description: If present, this is a method for this data type.
dataType.label: Data Type

dataTypeMethodNumber.brief: Internal, unique number assigned to the method name
dataTypeMethodNumber.description: This is an internal number that is unique to the method name (the part after :: in functionId) of a dataTypeMethod function.
dataTypeMethodNumber.label: Method Number

deprecated.description: This indicates that the function is deprecated and may go away at some point.
deprecated.label: Deprecated

description.description: This is the function's description, used for documentation purposes.
description.label: Description

errorsThrown.description: These are errors that can possibly be thrown by this function.
errorsThrown.label: Errors Thrown

functionDeclaration.description: This is the function's declaration with whitespace and brief comments.
functionDeclaration.label: Function Declaration

maximumNumberOfParameters.description: This is the maximum number of parameters or -1 if there is no maximum.
maximumNumberOfParameters.label: Maximum Parameters

numberOfRequiredParameters.description: This is the number of required parameters.
numberOfRequiredParameters.label: Required Parameters

op.description: This is the function's operator. This is not used at the moment, but may be used in a future expression syntax.
op.label: Op

polymorphic.brief: This function can be called polymorphically
polymorphic.description: This indicates that this function can be called polymorphically without specifying the <Type>:: qualifier. The appropriate implementation of the function will be called based on the dataType and/or dataTypeParameter of the first function parameter value.
polymorphic.label: Polymorphic

polymorphicDataTypes.brief: This function will call the appropriate function when the first parameter is one of these data types
polymorphicDataTypes.description: This function will call the appropriate function when the first parameter is one of these data types.
polymorphicDataTypes.label: Polymorphic Data Types

pure.brief: Given exactly the same parameter values, this function will always return the same result
pure.description: This indicates that, given exactly the same parameter values, this function will always return the same result and will not cause any side effects.
pure.label: Pure

scriptSupportNumber.description: If non-zero, this is an script support function and this is its internal special handling number. See #define AFW_VALUE_SCRIPT_SUPPORT_NUMBER_* in afw_value.h for more information.
scriptSupportNumber.label: Script Support Number

sideEffects.description: Any side effects that this function may produce as a result of execution.
sideEffects.label: Side Effects

signatureOnly.description: This is a signature with an unimplemented execute function.
signatureOnly.label: Signature Only

untypedFunctionId.description: This is the function's id without <dataType>. If this function is not polymorphic, this is the same as functionId.
untypedFunctionId.label: Function
